text:
This is true over long timescales, it's unclear how much selective pressure there is going to be on a brand new spillover in this short a period of time.

Also, the typical logic is that sick people are less mobile / less likely to spread, but for a virus where a lot of the infectious window appears to be asymptomatic, this pressure will be even lower.

All of this is to say that I haven't seen any evidence that there are substantive changes in virulence or transmissibility due to viral evolution (there were a couple of papers about one strain a while back, but their evidence was weak IMO). That said, I also wouldn't rule out the possibility that it *could* be happening and we just don't have sufficient evidence yet.
